message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the construction and analysis of codes for distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The focus on minimum storage regenerating (MSR) codes suggests that coding theory (cs.CC) is also relevant. The mention of a key definition inspired by Galois theory suggests that algebraic structures (cs.SI) may be involved. Finally, the use of lower bounds suggests that computational complexity (cs.NA) may also be relevant.
